body:
> Please remove `import org.apache.skywalking.oap.server.library.util.HealthChecker`. As in the module provider, we don't need that.

Sorry, I dont got it.

@kezhenxu94 's issue is caused by the base image of the main repo only. Not relate to the 8.1.0 or the codes.

If you like, check this PR about deploying SkyWalking of the latest codes on the k8s with Istio/Envoy, and analyze the service mesh.
Do you use `agent.is_cache_enhanced_class` as true or false? Default is false, you should use true, if you are facing duplicated enhancement.
Hi @kezhenxu94  I think I found a way to set the auth. will test and let you know
A year ago, I try the kubernetes cluster E2E test, but failed :smile:

The default nacos user is nacos, I test in my local docker env. it is ok now

` docker run --name nacos-standalone -e MODE=standalone  -p 8848:8848 -d nacos/nacos-server:1.3.1
`

Hi @wu-sheng ,  seems the failed e2e test are caused by unhealthy status, I can't find any error log about this, it seems the health check is not stable,  how to fix this ? 
```
14:03:08.217 INFO  🐳 [docker-compose].processLine (35) - ERROR: for oap2  Container "dcc4c103dba6" is unhealthy.
14:03:08.217 INFO  🐳 [docker-compose].processLine (35) - ERROR: for provider1  Container "dcc4c103dba6" is unhealthy.
```

Is there any sort of user roles used in Skywalking? It would be nice to have normal users and then the admins. Or is there going to be authentication support in future releases that would allow the use of LDAP, SSO or something else? Thanks.

T

> Multiple threads will report errors and update the connection status. When a certain thread reports an error, it happens that the GRPCChannelManager thread starts scheduling，After changing the connection status to connected, another thread reports an error and changes the status to disconnected. In extreme cases, the agent cannot be reconnected with OAP all the time.

How could that be possible if your OAP server is back to healthy, if you OAP server is healthy finally, all the threads should be able to finally change the status to connected. Otherwise there must be something else wrong. Do you have any extra information/logs?

OAP server is healthy, other agent can reconnnect to oap;Only one agent can't reconnect，but restarting the agent is normal .The agent debug log always reports that it is unable to connect and the segment data is ignored;The log file was removed when the agent was restarted
